paragraphs.text: Low-code platforms have emerged as a powerful solution, enabling organizations to automate processes quickly and efficiently without the need for extensive coding expertise.

This introduction to low-code platforms for business automation explores how these tools are transforming workflows, empowering teams to build custom solutions, and driving digital transformation across industries.
In today’s edition of tech Tuesday, we look at low-code solutions that can simplify complex tasks, reduce costs, and accelerate your business’s journey toward automation.

UiPath has announced the next evolution of enterprise automation – agentic automation. Agentic automation uses both robots and agents to complete work tasks. Robots automate repetitive and rule-based tasks, improving efficiency, and reducing manual effort, while agents adapt to changes, making intelligent decisions, and handling complex and dynamic processes. Agents complete critical business processes and tasks that were not previously possible to automate due to their ability to act independently and make dynamic decisions. UiPath has also announced the launch of Autopilot for everyone – a cross-platform, GenAI conversational agent that helps every employee enhance productivity at work regardless of their technical ability. Autopilot for everyone provides an intuitive LLM-based conversational experience, customisable prompts, vast automation libraries, and specialised AI models for specific tasks such as document understanding and semantic copy-paste. These tools can support employees in almost any industry including healthcare, manufacturing, finance and retail

MATLAB by Mathworks has become the preferred platform for millions of engineers and scientists across the globe, facilitating a comprehensive workflow that spans from data analysis and algorithm development to AI and the modelling and simulation of complex systems. Its application is widespread across various sectors, including aerospace, defence, communications, finance, renewable energy, mining, and automotive. In its commitment to empowering engineers to excel and expedite innovation, MATLAB has evolved into a low-codeenvironment. This evolution encompasses a desktop environment optimized for iterative analysis and design processes, alongside an iterative programming language. Furthermore, MATLAB is equipped with an extensive selection of apps that streamline common tasks and workflows in science, engineering, and research, eliminating the need for manual coding. These apps cover a broad range of functions, such as data analysis, control design, machine learning, and signal processing, making MATLAB a comprehensive tool for professionals in these fields.

Rippling is a comprehensive workforce management platform that integrates HR, payroll, IT,  finance, and more into a single, cohesive system. By consolidating employee data across 600+ apps into an all-in-one solution, Rippling enables small businesses to streamline operations and improve efficiency. Rippling automates critical but tedious admin work for payroll, labour compliance, and more — so business leaders can stay focused on building and running their company. As a low-codeplatform, Rippling allows businesses to build custom workflows and automate tasks without extensive coding knowledge. Rippling’s Workflow Studio enables users to build custom triggers and advanced actions, improving efficiency and allowing tailored automation to fit business needs.From onboarding to payroll, Rippling is disrupting the traditional Human Capital Management (HCM), Payroll and Workforce Management Industries. Through  automation which seamlessly connects with third-party applications, Rippling’s platform ensures smooth, coordinated processes. By  unifying all employee data, Rippling helps reduce manual work and allows businesses to effortlessly streamline their operations.

FezyFlow by FPT Software is a no-code workflow platform that empowers businesses of all sizes to streamline and digitise workflow processes, driving operational efficiency. Designed to transform ideas into real business solutions, FezyFlow supports various users, from business process owners to system administrators, with a fully customisable platform with no coding required. FezyFlow is quick to deploy, easy to integrate, and supports custom features to suit unique business requirements. Its comprehensive, user-friendly portal with visual interfaces is backed by FPT Software’s extensive support, including workflow standardisation, consulting, configuration services, and ongoing maintenance. Key features include FezyFlow Monitor, which provides real-time reporting and a dashboard with insights for identifying bottlenecks and areas for improvement; and FezyFlow Template, offering ready-made processes for HR, IT, and administrative functions.
